title: Richard Mayhew (rugby union)
text:
Richard Mayhew (born 24 June 1985 in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>) is a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Yorkshire%20Carnegie">Yorkshire Carnegie</a> in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a>. He plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%237.%20Flanker">flanker</a> or a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%238.%20Number%208">number 8</a>.
Mayhew started out playing rugby at local club Northcote, part of the <a href="North%20Harbour%20Rugby%20Union">North Harbour</a> Rugby Union. He first moved to England to join <a href="Wasps%20RFC">London Wasps</a> in 2010, but the deal fell through. Mayhew then played for <a href="National%20League%201">National League 1</a> side, <a href="Esher">Esher</a> before moving to Newcastle (alongside his brother Michael, who now plays for <a href="London%20Irish">London Irish</a>), making his debut against <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a> on the first day of the 2011-12 season.
